haReport:
This mission was flown by:
Kmdr Patrik Schorner
Obltn Oswald Fromm
Fw Gebhard Schonbaum
Uffz Karl Nostitz

 The mission was flown from Balatre aerodrome.

Successes include the following: 
On 02/10/1916 near Rosieres-en-Santerre.
A F.E.2b of Esc 21 was brought down by Patrik Schorner of Jasta 16b.
Jules Scala was lightly wounded.
Adolphe Bastoux was not injured.
Patrik Schorner was  flying a Albatros D.II.

On 02/10/1916 near Vauvillers.
A Nieuport 17.C1 of Esc 112 was brought down by Patrik Schorner of Jasta 16b.
Corentin Brindejonc was killed in action.
Patrik Schorner was  flying a Albatros D.II.

On 02/10/1916 near Vauvillers.
A Nieuport 11.C1 of Esc 112 was brought down by Karl Nostitz of Jasta 16b.
Emile Mourrut was not injured.
Karl Nostitz was  flying a Halberstadt D.II.
narrative:
Two victories but a stunning display of  incompetence.  I am livid.  First Schonbaum and Nostitz get tangled up and crash.  Then, as I am trying to pull a Nieuport off of his tail, Fromm clips my wing.  All four aircraft are writeoffs.  

Now the good.  The new Albatros scout is remarkable.  When one uses its power one is not threatened.The two guns make short work of both the French pusher and the Nieuport scout that I bring down.
